extendedIngredients.name: carrot
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large carrot, peeled and cut into 1-inch thick wedges

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 to 3 cloves garlic, peeled and minced

extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 small green bell pepper, seeded and sliced into 1/2-inch thick strips

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small onion, peeled and sliced thinly

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 small red bell pepper, seeded and sliced into 1/2-inch thick strips

extendedIngredients.name: whole chicken
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound whole chicken, cut into parts

recipes.title: Chicken Afritada

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Downton Abbey Countess of Grantham Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Downton Abbey Countess of Grantham Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Our Downton Abbey Chardonnay displays lovely aromas of tropical fruits and subtle oak on the nose, which give way to flavors of citrus and fresh-cut pineapple on a soft, silky palate. The wine's bright characters and luscious mouthfeel continue through a clean, medium finish. The beautifully balanced and food-friendly bottling is the perfect wine choice for you most regal gatherings or spontaneous get-togethers.

recipes.instructions: In a pan over medium heat, heat about 1 inch of oil. Add potatoes and cook, turning once or twice, for about 2 to 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Add carrots to pan and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Add bell pepper and cook for about 30 to 45 seconds. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Add chicken and cook, turning on sides once or twice, until lightly browned but not cooked through. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.In a pot, heat about 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic and cook, stirring regularly, until aromatic. Add fish sauce and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook, mashing regularly with back of spoon, until softened and release juices. Add chicken and water and bring to a boil. Lower heat, cover and cook for about 30 to 40 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Add more water in 1/2 cup increments, if necessary. Add potatoes and carrots and continue to cook for about 5 minutes or until fork tender and sauce is thickened and reduced. Add bell peppers and sweet peas. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until sweet peas are heated through and bell peppers are tender yet crisp. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

steps.step: In a pan over medium heat, heat about 1 inch of oil.
Add potatoes and cook, turning once or twice, for about 2 to 3 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.
Add carrots to pan and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes or until lightly browned.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.
Add bell pepper and cook for about 30 to 45 seconds.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.
Add chicken and cook, turning on sides once or twice, until lightly browned but not cooked through.
Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.In a pot, heat about 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic and cook, stirring regularly, until aromatic.
Add fish sauce and cook for about 1 to 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook, mashing regularly with back of spoon, until softened and release juices.
Add chicken and water and bring to a boil. Lower heat, cover and cook for about 30 to 40 minutes or until chicken is cooked.
Add more water in 1/2 cup increments, if necessary.
Add potatoes and carrots and continue to cook for about 5 minutes or until fork tender and sauce is thickened and reduced.
Add bell peppers and sweet peas. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until sweet peas are heated through and bell peppers are tender yet crisp. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
